newsitem.title: UK: Legal & General up on Direct Line results.
newsitem.headline: Legal & General up on Direct Line results.

text.p: Shares in major UK insurers advanced on Wednesday after Royal Bank of Scotland posted stronger-than-expected results for its insurance arm, Direct Line, dealers said.
Legal & General shares led the sector higher, gaining 10-1/2p to 449 at 1043 GMT, having risen to a record at 452.

Shares in Prudential Corp and Royal Sun Alliance also scored records. Prudential shares were up 12-1/2p to 634-1/2, after setting a new peak at 637p earlier. Royal Sun jumped 9-1/2p to 511p, just 6p off its record level set earlier.
General Accident firmed 15-1/2p to 932, after an initial advance up to 937 initially.

Dealers attributed the sector-wide rally to the small increase in profit posted by Direct Line. The insurance group, whose results were expected to be neutral to negative, posted a small increase in profits, putting them at eight million pounds for the half year to March 31.
"Insurance stocks took heart from the (Direct Line) figures, said one dealer.

The financial sector, already strong after Labour on Tuesday moved to give the Bank of England more independence is setting monetary policy, remained firm, with most major bank shares rising to record levels as well. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
